Message.Title: COMPUTEX TAIPEI 2013
Message.Msg: Computex 6/4-8, Taipei. Hope to see a couple of T4 devices. E3 6/11-13, LA. Any other positive surprises?

Message.Title: The great Clover trailed
Message.Msg: Google it "Back to Clover Trail, this joke of a chip is bigger yet. Double the core count and massively increase the GPU size, and what do you end up with? Increasing the size of the two largest units on the chip may not double the area, but it won’t be far off that mark. Clover Trail is massive, so big that it is not economically viable in the markets that they are fighting for. That promise from the last financial analyst day of good margins on Atom in the phone/tablet market would go up in smoke if Intel released the die size, and they know it. Intel can’t compete in tablets and phones." Every Smart Phone chip Intel had ever came up with was garbage big BIG - so BIG that Quad cores are unimaginable. 25% GM! Sell Sell Sell INTC - Its heading the way of Xerox, Kodak, Rimm. Their BOD must be illiterate! The writing is on the wall - downward acceleration begins after Logan is released.

Message.Title: Is this the Hate SNE, MSFT, AAPL, AMD, INTC and QCOM Board because Nvidia sucks? lol
Message.Msg: If you Nvidia fans don't stop hating every outfit that Takes Nvidia's job or Fires Nvidia from a job there won't be any Techs left to play with. And I didn't even mention bashing HP for supporting AMD. When the next Nexus 7 is announced with a QCOM part will you Nvidia fans be adding Google to that Hate list? lmao I guess that's what happens when you invest in junk and then blaime everyone else when it goes sour but that clown in the mirror who put you in junk in the first place, right? lol imho

Message.Title: More post HERE about Xbox One and PS4 than SHIELD and you know why too, don't you?
Message.Msg: SHIELD is %&#& and no one cares about a condom sounding pocket toy, not even Nvidia fans pretending that SHIELD wasn't the DUMBEST idea Nvidia let leave HQ and roam wild. Xbox One and PS4 will continue to dominate the Game Console headlines from now through Xmas when the first reports of Apple style LONGS LINES and SOLD OUT start oppping up. lol IMHO

One thing never changes about you guys and that is your consistent delusional underestimation of Intel's mobile efforts. You would think the way Clover Trail killed Tegra 3 Surface stone dead would have given you a clue. More clues ... venturebeatDOTcom/2013/05/24/source-confirms-intel-scores-with-an-atom-chip-in-upcoming-samsung-tablet/ sammobileDOTcom/2013/05/27/retailer-adorama-posts-price-galaxy-tab-3-8-0-and-10-1-online/ engadgetDOTcom/2013/04/10/zte-geek-intel-clover-trail-plus/ engadgetDOTcom/2013/01/08/lenovo-k900-intel-clover-trail/ ameinfoDOTcom/intel-asus-launch-atom-powered-asus-fonepad-341015

Topic.Title: Game Console Sour Grapes Served Here Compliments of Sony and Microsoft

Message.Msg: All this chatter about the Xbox One and the PS4 on the Nvidia board when Nvidia won't see a dime from either one of these products must be all about AMD ENVY. With each bashing post about Xbox One and PS4 you Nvidia fans are just parroting the same BS that Nvidia put out. Nvidia claimed they didn't want the now estimated $9 BILLION MSFT and SNE will be handing out because they were TOO BUSY. TOO BUSY delaying Tegra 4, looking for a new Tegra UNIT HEAD and readying a condom sounding SHIELD Toy, right? Sounds like a good reasons to blow off $9 BILLION to me. lol You can always pick up a $9 BILLION deal but when can you work on your a condom sounding SHIELD Toy right? You Nvidia fans swallowed Nvidia's BS and NEVER questioned the fact that Nvidia DOES NOT HAVE an 8 Core 64 Bit CPU+GPU SoC to sell anyone. IMHO

took Intel quite a few years to answer the Athlon 64 serial memory bus. But when they did, they buried AMD. And there are guys here who calls himself so analyst while he cannot model a product line and is so delusional he thinks Tegra has an advantage in running Android. Zero clue about what's underneath Android. I would not be surprised that when Intel is through, ARMs will be the AMDs of the world, relegated to the entry low $ margin segments.
ltenow, Short Intel if you are so confident.

If Intel finally catches up in the performance per watt department, then they will need to effectively compete on price which might be an obstacle for a costly, massive vertically integrated company that Intel is. The final obstacle that Intel would encounter, & not used to is penetrating a very established, & highly competitive sector where customers & developers are very acclimated & content with ARM. I'm not saying it's impossible, but it might just be an insurmountable task even for Intel and its mega billions, and not being in the comfortable monopolistic position that allowed them to manipulate many aspects, legally & illegally, since Intel's inception. Perhaps this is one sector where Intel will not compete effectively in, and will have to be content with dominating most everything else.

", & not used to is penetrating a very established, & highly competitive sector where customers & developers are very acclimated & content with ARM" Right, remember how Intel took over the server space? IBM's POWER and Oracle's SPARC are on their last breaths as Xeon E7 cleans up what's left of that market. Intel started from 0. And what's this nonsense about Intel not being able to compete on cost. They have their own fabs, have a node size advantage, amortize the R&D across multiple product lines that ship in high volume, and don't pay ARM a dime. Seems like the cost structure is actually in Intel's favor.

Ashraf, I think we're talking about margins and what Intel is willing to sacrifice in terms of profitability to win in mobile. What Intel charges in their mobile chips is part of the concern about their 'costly' vertical structure and how they see themselves compensated in the mobile space by the price point the expect.
this message belongs on the intel board, people are allowed to talk smack about intel here

Internet chatter indicate that a new ASUS transformer featuring Tegra 4 may be in the works. Last week, a teaser video was released by ASUS, touting this mysterious beast. There is a good chance that this tablet will be announced in two weeks at Computex 2013.
I used to think that. I believe that I was wrong. I don't believe Intel intends to give up any margins at all. I believe they will to sell at premium prices and relegate ARM to AMD status.

E3 will be the best time to see how the targeted market at the show gravitates to the Shield? I'm sure Nvidia will pull-out all the stops by demonstrating the cool features, & scenarios. It would be cool to have the large booth set-up in the variety of configurations/settings like streaming the latest and most powerful PC games to a large LED while sitting on a couch, flying a drone as demonstrated at the Nvidia site, and playing Shield in various settings for the gamer on the move. Since it's around the availability date they should have a boatload for sale at the show.
The same exact arguments hit Intel when the "Celeron" came out. There will always be a low end, and no it won't kill profitability ;)

I'm not knocking the capability of Intel here, but margins will be affected. Look at how important margins are to every other semi for investors and fund managers. It's been a major concern of Intel by analysts. Nvidia's recent stability in the stock price can be attributed in part to the positive surprise in their margins. You can argue that many semis would be farther along now if it weren't for the concern to keep the margins at a reasonable level for an investor's outlooks. Too much capital in the development too fast makes it hard to keep the margins up, if not the profits. Ashraf, I respect your bullish position(s) but this is a valid point.

It's usually not a good idea to spread misinformation about the competitors to your investment; this leads to very bad investment decisions. I am long both Intel and Nvidia, and I respect each firms' strengths and weaknesses, and think both are pretty reasonably priced. If ARM ever craters to $15-$20, I'll be positive on them, too. People tend to forget that this is a stock market, not a fanboy club. Think of all the $ left on the table by the folks who wouldn't touch AMD at $2.50 or so simply because Nvidia is a better company? Yes, Nvidia is better, and it is good to own, but there is money to be made owning competitors too.
